title: Michael.Franks-The.Art.of.Tea(1975)
description:
Disc image in CloneCD format (.ccd, .img, .sub)


Artist: Michael Franks 
Album: The Art of Tea
Year of Release: 1975
Label: Reprise
Genre: Jazz / Pop

Track listing: 
1) Nightmoves (4:03)
2) Eggplant (3:34)
3) Monkey See-Monkey Do (3:33)
4) St. Elmo's Fire (3:58)
5) I Don't Know Why I'm So Happy I'm Sad (4:16)
6) Jive (3:16)
7) Popsicle Toes (4:35)
8) Sometimes I Just Forget To Smile (3:45)
9) Mr. Blue (4:03)

Liner notes:
Produced by Tommy LiPuma

Featuring his initial hit single, the whimsical 
"Popsicle Toes," this 1976 LP established 
Michael Franks as a singer/writer/performer who 
could appeal to pop, jazz and adult audiences. 
Subsequent LPs, including Burchfield Nines, 
Objects of Desire and 1983's Passionfruit, have 
seen Franks work with the best session musicians 
in the business, a tradition begun on The 
Art Of Tea when producer Tommy LiPuma 
teamed Michael with members of the Crusaders.


Band: 
Joe Sample - Keyboards
Larry Carlton - Guitars
John Guerin - Drums, Percussion
Wilton Felder - Bass

Guest musicians: 
Michael Brecker - Tenor sax on "Jive"
David Sanborn - Alto Sax on "Monkey See-Monkey Do" and "Mr. Blue"
Larry Bunker - Vibes
Jerry Steinholtz - Congas
